Name: Requiring the police dept to submit reports on clearance rates of index crimes.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to submit reports on clearance rates of index crimes

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Hearing Scheduled by Mayor
History.MinutesNote: This bill was noticed but did not have a Mayoral public hearing on 12-18-2017

History.Description: This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted
History.MinutesNote: This bill was returned unsigned on Jan. 17, 2018 (31st Day, Jan. 11, 2018).

History.Description: This Introduction was Returned Unsigned by Mayor

Summary: This bill would require the New York City Police Department to report on the clearance rates for index crimes by borough.
RTF:
{\rtf1\fbidis\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1033{\fonttbl{\f0\froman\fprq2\fcharset0 Times New Roman;}}

\viewkind4\uc1
\v0  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\fs24 Section 1.  Chapter 1 of title 14 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 14-171 to read as follows:\fs27\par
\ul\fs24\'a714-171. Index crime clearance report. a. The term \ldblquote clearance rate\rdblquote  means the number of specific crimes where at least one person has been arrested, not including voided arrests, divided by the total number of such crimes reported.\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 b. No later than 30 days after the quarter ending December 31, 2017 and 30 days after every quarter thereafter, the department shall publish on the department\rquote s website a report for the prior quarter, which shall include a report for each borough, of the clearance rate for the following crimes:\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 1. Homicide as defined in article 125 of the penal law;\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 2. Rape as defined in article 130 of the penal law;\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 3. Robbery as defined in article 160 of the penal law;\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 4. Felony assault as defined in article 120 of the penal law;\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 5. Burglary as defined in article 140 of the penal law;\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 6. Grand larceny as defined in article 155 of the penal law; and\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 7. Grand larceny involving the theft of a motor vehicle as defined in article 155 of the penal law.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\fs24\'a72.  This local law takes effect immediately.\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\qj\fs20  \fs27\par
